data:
Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hello Myrcella,

 

I didn’t use Craigslist, but Apartment Finder has two apartments in the Corvallis area under $700 that don’t allow pets.

They are both one bedroom only so roommates shouldn’t be an issue.

 

Here are the links:

http://www.apartmentfinder.com/Oregon/Corvallis-Apartments/204-Nw-17th-St-Apartments-0tkcvv1

http://www.apartmentfinder.com/Oregon/Corvallis-Apartments/Greenwood-Manor-Apartments

 

I hope you find a place that works out for you, and I hope this helped.

 

Sincerely,

-Charles Chattsworth

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Tuesday, October 11, 2016 2:11 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Charles,




Thank you so much! I usually use Craigslist as well, but it seems you found nice places without it.




Myrcella

	Hello Myrcella,

	 

	I didn’t use Craigslist, but Apartment Finder has two apartments in the Corvallis area under $700 that don’t allow pets.

	They are both one bedroom only so roommates shouldn’t be an issue.

	http://www.apartmentfinder.com/Oregon/Corvallis-Apartments/204-Nw-17th-St-Apartments-0tkcvv1

	http://www.apartmentfinder.com/Oregon/Corvallis-Apartments/Greenwood-Manor-Apartments

	 

	I hope you find a place that works out for you, and I hope this helped.

	 

	Sincerely,

	-Charles Chattsworth

	To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu> <mailto:Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu> 
	Subject:  Housing... OMG!

	 

	Hi there,
	As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
	I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
	Thank you ever so much, 
	Myrcella

Hi!
 
There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?
 
Thank you, 
 
Myrcella

Hello again Myrcella,

 

This Saturday and Sunday, the weather is expected to be pretty bad for a picnic.

 

Google says there’s a 90-100% chance of precipitation/rain on both days and it’s expected to last for a few days. If I were you I would skip the sunscreen and bring a raincoat and an umbrella. I would also probably skip on the picnic.

 

I hope this helped.

 

Sincerely,

-Charles Chattsworth

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Tuesday, October 11, 2016 2:20 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Weather?

 

 

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Ugh...guess it's that time of the year again :(. Thanks alot though for the warning.




Myrcella

Hello Charles,
 
I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!
 
Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  
 
Thank you, 
 
Myrcella

Hello Myrcella,

 

Here are 4 recipes I found that should be a hit at your event.

I picked 3 vegan options and one non vegan just in case.

 

Here are 3 vegan options from Martha Stewart’s website, so you know they’ll be good.

Spring Rolls with Carrot Ginger Dipping Sauce:

http://www.marthastewart.com/315105/spring-rolls-with-carrot-ginger-dipping

No cooking involved, just lots of raw veggies wrapped in a wrap.

 

Tomato-Basil Crostini:

http://www.marthastewart.com/315105/spring-rolls-with-carrot-ginger-dipping

Once again, no cooking needed. Just throw the veggies and other ingredients together and you got yourself some veggie spread. Serve over some gluten free bread.

 

Sweet Potato Wedges with Sesame-Soy Dipping Sauce:

http://www.marthastewart.com/336131/sweet-potato-wedges-with-sesame-soy-dipp

Pretty easy to make as well. Bake some sweet potato wedges and mix soy-sauce, rice-wine vinegar and sesame oil.

 

Non vegan option:

Artichoke & Spinach Dip Restaurant Style:

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/33474/artichoke-spinach-dip-restaurant-style/?internalSource=hub%20recipe&referringId=76&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%2021

Some baking involved for this one as well, but should be pretty delicious. This has lots of high ratings.

 

Most of these recipes should be pretty fast and easy to make. Just make sure the oven is ready as soon as possible so there’s no waiting on it.

I hope your event goes well.

 

Sincerely,

Charles Chattsworth

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Tuesday, October 11, 2016 2:28 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>

Charles,




Those wedges look amazing O.O . Good taste!




Myrcella

	Once again, no cooking needed. Just throw the veggies and other ingredients together and you got yourself some veggie spread. Serve over some gluten free bread.

	 

	Sweet Potato Wedges with Sesame-Soy Dipping Sauce:

Hello Charles,
 
Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price! :)
 
Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.
 
Textbooks Needed:
Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273
 
Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3
 
Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!
 
Thanks! :) :) :)
Myrcella

Hello Myrcella,

 

I recommend buying the books on Abebooks because they are reliable and I’ve gotten a few books from them with no issues.

 

Here are the two books you wanted.

Engineering Economic Analysis: $118.98 new, $81.96 used, $4 shipping. I recommend buying used.

http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=20527829888&clickid=Uzx0pvXBPVHWzt80CA2cwzegUkkUVIzn0QwU3E0&cm_mmc=aff-_-ir-_-99852-_-77798&ref=imprad99852&afn_sr=impact

 

Linux Kernel Development - $10.20 new, $5 shipping:

http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=19950596928&clickid=Uzx0pvXBPVHWzt80CA2cwzegUkkUVLSH0QwU3E0&cm_mmc=aff-_-ir-_-99852-_-77798&ref=imprad99852&afn_sr=impact

 

If you buy all used you should have around $100 left to spend on other things. Abebooks has the cheapest prices according to a textbook price comparison site, so you’re probably getting the best deal available. If you order now you’ll get the books within 5-14 days, but they’ll usually get here by next week. If you need them ASAP there’s always the faster shipping options. If you don’t trust the books to arrive in time you can try buying them on Amazon, they are usually pretty fast and have reliable delivery.

 

I hope this helped.

 

-Charles Chattsworth

 

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu]

To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>

Myrcella

Hi, Charles ,
 
Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 
 
I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 
 
What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.
 
Thank you so much! 

Melisandre

Hi Melisandre,

 

http://www.imdb.com/search/title?genres=drama&sort=user_rating,desc&title_type=tv_series,mini_series&num_votes=5000,&pf_rd_m=A2FGELUUNOQJNL&pf_rd_p=2295992002&pf_rd_r=08P7QBKA8MDR1WYWR3YN&pf_rd_s=right-6&pf_rd_t=15506&pf_rd_i=toptv&ref_=chttvtp_gnr_8

 

I looked over the IMDb list of top rated drama TV shows. Aside from the ones you have already seen, the other top 3 are:

Breaking Bad(9.5 rating, 2 Golden Globes), 

Band of Brothers(9.5 rating, 1 Golden Globe),

The Wire(9.4 rating, 2 Primetime Emmys).

 

I recommend trying those 3 first.

 

Have fun!

-Charles Chattsworth

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

Thanks Charles!

Sounds like there will be a Breaking Bad binge in my future :).

Melisandre

Hi there!
 
I need to buy a gift for a friend.
 
My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.
She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).
I will need something that will get here on time.
Nothing that will take too long to ship please.
 
I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.
Please spend as close to that as you can.
 
Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.
 
Thank you,
Melisandre

Hello Melisandre,

 

I found something that’s really nice that can be used for indoor/outdoor activities.

https://www.amazon.com/Double-Wall-Insulated-Rambler-Tumbler-CoffeeThermos/dp/B01HX306LE/ref=sr_1_60?ie=UTF8&qid=1476230786&sr=8-60&keywords=pink%2Boutdoor&th=1

It’s a fancy tumbler/rambler whatever. It’s hot pink and are really well built. Arrives by October 13.

 

If that’s not her style, there’s this awesome outdoors knife.

https://www.amazon.com/Morakniv-Companion-Outdoor-Stainless-4-1-Inch/dp/B00EAL0TVA/ref=sr_1_28?ie=UTF8&qid=1476230756&sr=8-28&keywords=pink%2Boutdoor&th=1

Can be used for whatever she wants, shaving wood, skinning fish, or whatever outdoors activity she does.

Arrives October 15-18.

 

Best of luck,

Charles Chattsworth

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Tuesday, October 11, 2016 5:02 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Find a Gift for Someone

Please spend as close to that as you can.

Thank you,

Melisandre

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

 

Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

 

Davos

Hi Davos,

 

According to a few sources, Adderall gives energy and focus, and Valium calms them down. That’s kind of a contradiction.

 

Valium and grapefruit/grapefruit juice has dangerous side effects, along with alcohol. It is also not recommended to be obese when taking it.

https://www.drugs.com/food-interactions/diazepam,valium.html

 

Adderall and alcohol do not mix, avoid CNS stimulants while on it and if you have high blood pressure you could get hypertension.

https://www.drugs.com/food-interactions/amphetamine-dextroamphetamine,adderall.html

 

Hope this helps.

-Charles Chattsworth

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Tuesday, October 11, 2016 5:40 PM

Subject:  check on medication

Cheers,

D. Stark

Hello Charles,

 

I know graduating is coming up soon for you. It would be good to do a preliminary job search. Please find at least 1 job and send me an email with the link(s) to the job(s) you applied for. 

 

 

Here is the link for one job search site to get started. 

 

http://www.indeed.com 

 

Job criteria: 

 

You should find a computer engineering job. 

 

Must start after September 2016.

 

For now, just find one or more jobs you believe will work out well. We can talk about them further at our next meeting.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Davos

Hello Davos,

 

Here is an interesting job posting I found on indeed.com.

 

https://us-amazon.icims.com/jobs/451326/software-development-engineer-%28android%29/job?iis=Job+Posting&iisn=Indeed+%28Paid+Sponsored+Posting%29&mobile=false&width=589&height=1200&bga=true&needsRedirect=false&jan1offset=-480&jun1offset=-420

 

It should be within your criteria.

 

Best of luck,

Charles Chattsworth

Hello Charles,



I am your academic advisor.



Below is a list of classes you must enroll in for Fall Term 2016 (yes, it’s actually still summer right now):



ST 314

PAC 201

WR 121

COMM 111

H 100

Note** Do not worry if there is no space in the class. I will make sure you get a spot in the class.



In order to view the available times for these classes please use the OSU catalog<http://catalog.oregonstate.edu/Default.aspx?section=Course>.



Please provide me with a list of the CRNs so that I can finish your registration process.

Once you have been registered, I will provide you with the list of textbooks you will need for your classes. Since the textbook selection will be shared, we require all textbooks be acquired legally.



Thank you,
Professor Targaryen

Hello Professor,

Here are the requested CRN's for Fall 2016.

ST 314 - 20855 sec 002

PAC 201 - 10050 sec 007

WR 121 - 10100 sec 007

COMM 111 - 15081 sec 010

H 100 -  15217 sec 001

Let me know if there are any issues.


Sincerely,

Charles Chattsworth

-----Original Message-----
From: Targaryen, Arya 
Sent: Tuesday, October 11, 2016 2:59 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Create an Ideal Class Schedule

Hello Charles,



I am your academic advisor.



Below is a list of classes you must enroll in for Fall Term 2016 (yes, it’s actually still summer right now):



ST 314

PAC 201

WR 121

COMM 111

H 100

Note** Do not worry if there is no space in the class. I will make sure you get a spot in the class.



In order to view the available times for these classes please use the OSU catalog<http://catalog.oregonstate.edu/Default.aspx?section=Course>.



Please provide me with a list of the CRNs so that I can finish your registration process.

Once you have been registered, I will provide you with the list of textbooks you will need for your classes. Since the textbook selection will be shared, we require all textbooks be acquired legally.



Thank you,
Professor Targaryen

Greetings, traveler,

 

I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.

 

The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.

 

The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:

 

A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?

 

This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.

 

Kind regards,

Davos Stark

Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

Hello Davos,

 

Istanbul - Turkey:

Political Climate: Islamic, led by Erdogan, a branded dictator

US Ally: No

Turmoil: Kind of, there have been recent ISIS attacks, including one at the airport.

Embassy: Yes

Safe: Not really

 

Sofia - Bulgaria:

Political Climate: Democratic republic

US Ally: Yes, part of NATO

Turmoil: No

Embassy: Yes

Safe: Yes

 

Macedonia:

Political Climate: parliamentary republic

US Ally: Yes

Turmoil: No

Embassy: Yes

Safe: Yes

 

Tirana - Albania:

Political Climate: Parliamentary representative democratic government

US Ally: Yes

Turmoil: No

Embassy: Yes

Safe:Yes

 

Basically stay away from Turkey. Everywhere else is cool.

Hope this helps.

 

-Charles Chattsworth
